messages.title: Why we're backing Labour
messages.content: This is the most important election of our lives. The recovery needs your vote to carry on.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour's team led Britain from the recession to recovery, risking handing power to an inexperienced, unchanged Tory party that got every call on the recession wrong would be a mistake.
Labour will continue to support the economy, secure the recovery and give a future of jobs guarantee to all 18-24 year olds out of work for six months.
With Labour, all cancer patients are guaranteed to see a cancer specialist within two weeks of GP referral and all cancer tests results be completed and the results received within just one week.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: David Cameron tells us the Conservatives have changed, that they are no longer the 'nasty party,' that he wants the UK to be 'one of the most family-friendly nations in Europe,' but I, for one, am not buying it, JK Rowling
mentions.tacticalSituation: Like Lib Dems, you get Tory! Like the Tories, you get Lib Dem. Don't want to trust Child Tax Credits and Child Trust Funds. The Lib Dem Leader, Nick Clegg, won't rule out a backing the Tories in a hung parliament.

issues.economy: Our economy is recovering. Now is not the time for help for families. Now is the time for experience. Now is the time to vote Labour
issues.health: With Labour, all cancer patients are guaranteed to see a cancer specialist within two weeks of GP referral and all cancer tests results be completed and the results received within just one week.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour tax credits will be increased not cut. Protecting public services

housing.content: Labour tax credits will help families get on, not just get by.

endorsements.endorsement: David Cameron tells us the Conservatives have changed, that they are no longer the 'nasty party,' that he wants the UK to be 'one of the most family-friendly nations in Europe,' but I, for one, am not buying it.
On 6 May there is a big choice to make. It's Labour or Tory. And the Tories stand for the privileged few. They can't be trusted with our future, hospitals and our schools. Vote Labour.

quotes.text: We all agree on one thing. It's vital that Labour wins this election. Because if we make a mess of the economy now, we are in deep trouble.
quotes.source: Patrick Stewart OBE, Sir Alex Ferguson, Jo Brand, Tony Robinson, John Middleton, Eddie Izzard, Liz Dawn

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes the risk of voting for the Conservative Party, pointing out that Labour's tax credits will be increased not cut and highlighting the importance of the continued recovery under Labour.
